TAS2560 I2C Audio Amplifier Driver
devices

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides a comprehensive hardware abstraction layer for the Texas Instruments TAS2560 digital audio amplifier. The driver enables high-quality audio playback through I2C control interface, supporting multiple sample rates, channel configurations, and audio processing features. It uses configuration tables generated by TI's PPC3 (Purepath Console 3) tool for optimal audio performance and system integration in embedded audio applications.

Key Features

  1. High-Quality Audio Amplification: Digital Class-D amplifier with excellent audio fidelity.
  2. Multiple Sample Rates: Support for 8kHz, 16kHz, 44.1kHz, and 48kHz audio streams.
  3. Channel Configuration: Mono, stereo, left-only, and right-only channel modes.
  4. Mute/Unmute Control: Software-controlled audio muting with smooth transitions.
  5. I2C Interface: Standard I2C communication for control and configuration.
  6. TI PPC3 Integration: Uses configuration tables generated by TI PPC3 tool.
  7. Book/Page Architecture: Advanced register organization for complex configurations.
  8. Audio Processing: Built-in DSP capabilities for audio enhancement.

Functionality

  • Initialize and configure TAS2560 amplifier via I2C interface
  • Configure audio sample rates for different audio applications
  • Set channel configuration for mono, stereo, or single-channel operation
  • Control audio muting and unmuting with smooth transitions
  • Load configuration tables generated by TI PPC3 tool
  • Handle book/page register addressing for advanced configurations
  • Manage I2C communication with robust error handling
  • Support bulk data loading for complex audio processing setups

Usage

  1. Initialize I2C interface with am_devices_tas2560_i2c_init()
  2. Initialize TAS2560 device with am_devices_tas2560_init()
  3. Configure sample rate with am_devices_tas2560_set_sample_rate()
  4. Set channel configuration with am_devices_tas2560_set_channel()
  5. Control audio muting with am_devices_tas2560_set_mute()
  6. Play audio through configured amplifier
  7. Deinitialize device with am_devices_tas2560_deinit()
  8. Deinitialize I2C interface with am_devices_tas2560_i2c_deinit()

Configuration

  • Set up I2C interface parameters and timing
  • Configure audio sample rates based on application requirements
  • Set up channel configuration for audio system topology
  • Load PPC3-generated configuration tables for optimal performance
  • Configure book/page addressing for advanced register access
  • Set up mute control timing and behavior
  • Optimize I2C communication parameters for reliable operation

Macros

#define CFG_META_SWITCH   (255)
 
#define CFG_META_DELAY   (254)
 
#define CFG_META_BURST   (253)
 
#define TAS2560_MDELAY   0xFFFFFFFE
 
#define TAS2560_MSLEEP   0xFFFFFFFD
 
#define TAS2560_END   0xFFFFFFFF
 
#define TAS2560_PAGECTL_REG   0
 
#define TAS2560_BOOKCTL_PAGE   0
 
#define TAS2560_BOOKCTL_REG   0x7F
 
#define TAS2560_REG(book, page, reg)   (((book * 256 * 128) + (page * 128)) + reg)
 
#define TAS2560_BOOK_ID(reg)   (reg / (256 * 128))
 
#define TAS2560_PAGE_ID(reg)   ((reg % (256 * 128)) / 128)
 
#define TAS2560_BOOK_REG(reg)   (reg % (256 * 128))
 
#define TAS2560_PAGE_REG(reg)   ((reg % (256 * 128)) % 128)
 
#define TAS2560_MUTE_REG   TAS2560_REG(0, 0, 7)
 
#define TAS2560_SR_CTRL1   TAS2560_REG(0, 0, 8)
 
#define TAS2560_LOAD   TAS2560_REG(0, 0, 9)
 
#define TAS2560_SR_CTRL2   TAS2560_REG(0, 0, 13) /* B0_P0_R0x0d*/
 
#define TAS2560_SR_CTRL3   TAS2560_REG(0, 0, 14) /* B0_P0_R0x0e*/
 
#define TAS2560_DAI_FMT   TAS2560_REG(0, 0, 20) /*B0_P0_R0x14*/
 
#define TAS2560_CHANNEL   TAS2560_REG(0, 0, 21) /*B0_P0_R0x15*/
 
#define TAS2560_DAI_FMT_VALUE   0x6c
 
#define TAS2560_DAI_WORD_LENGTH_MASK   0x03
 
#define AM_DEVICES_TAS2560_I2C_WR   0x0000
 
#define AM_DEVICES_TAS2560_I2C_RD   (1u << 0)
